messages.content: How do I install the ComfyUI-Gelbooru custom node?

To install ComfyUI-Gelbooru, you need to navigate to the custom_nodes directory in your ComfyUI installation, use git to clone the repository from https://github.com/1mckw/Comfyui-Gelbooru.git, and then restart ComfyUI.
What does the Gelbooru(Random) node in ComfyUI-Gelbooru do?

The Gelbooru(Random) node in ComfyUI-Gelbooru allows users to get random images from the Gelbooru database, supporting multiple tag searches and the ability to exclude tags. It also supports the optional use of a user ID and API key for authentication.
How should I format multiple tags when using the Gelbooru(Random) node?

When using the Gelbooru(Random) node with multiple tags, they should be separated by commas, and each tag must have a comma, including the last one. For example, if you want to search for 'cat' and 'dog', the tag input should be 'cat,dog'.
How does the Gelbooru(Random) node handle image size when requesting multiple images?
When requesting multiple images with the Gelbooru(Random) node, the image size will be the same as the first image returned by the search.
Where can I find additional information or custom nodes for ComfyUI?
You can find additional information and custom nodes for ComfyUI, such as the ComfyUI-Gelbooru node, on GitHub at the following repository: https://github.com/wmatson/easy-comfy-nodes.
